title: Ogier cuts Evans' WRC lead before Saudi finale
summary: Elfyn Evans will take a World Rally Championship lead of just three points into the final round of the season after rival Sebastien Ogier wins Rally Japan.

title: Farrell savours long-awaited debut after career 'lifeline'
summary: Ireland centre Tom Farrell says he was determined to make the most of his long-awaited Test debut in Saturday's win over Japan.

title: Man City and Liverpool become hunters - how key is Etihad meeting?
summary: BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty questions how important the outcome of Sunday's Etihad meeting will be to Manchester City and Liverpool's title hopes.

title: Van Gerwen survives Greaves scare as Littler wins
summary: Three-time world champion Michael van Gerwen overcomes Beau Greaves in a thriller, while reigning champion Luke Littler opens his Grand Slam of Darts title defence with a victory.

title: Arundell pace and quality bench power England home
summary: Like last week against Australia, England's star bench, led by Henry Arundell, proves the difference against Fiji in the final quarter.

title: Advertising boards & chaos - how Sunderland stopped Arsenal machine
summary: Sunderland halt Arsenal's winning run to give hope to the Premier League chasing pack, with the way they stifled the leaders catching the eye.

title: Chelsea see off managerless Wolves to move up to second
summary: Alejandro Garnacho stars for Chelsea in a comfortable 3-0 win over managerless Wolves at Stamford Bridge, as the home side move up to second in the Premier League table.

title: West Ham produce comeback to beat relegation rivals Burnley
summary: West Ham come from a goal down to beat Burnley 3-2 at the London Stadium, as Nuno Espirito Santo's side earn a second consecutive win for the first time this season in the Premier League.

title: Everton end winless run with victory over Fulham
summary: Goals from Idrissa Gueye and Michael Keane help Everton end their three-match winless run with a 2-0 win over Fulham at the Hill Dickinson Stadium.

title: Sunderland battle for draw as Arsenal's winning streak ends
summary: Brian Brobbey scores a dramatic injury-time equaliser for Sunderland against Arsenal, who concede their first goals since September to end a run of 10 consecutive wins in all competitions.

title: Spurs and Man Utd share points after chaotic climax
summary: Matthijs De Ligt scores an equaliser deep in to stoppage time, cancelling out Richarlison's 91st minute goal as Tottenham and Manchester United play out a 2-2 draw.

title: Springboks win in Paris despite De Jager red card
summary: World champions South Africa complete another memorable victory over France in Paris despite playing for more than half of the match with 14 men.

title: Norris has 'lessened weaknesses' as he builds on title lead
summary: Lando Norris has every prospect of extending his championship lead further at the Sao Paulo Grand Prix as he continues a strong run of form.

title: Spurs eye move for Everton winger Ndiaye - Sunday's gossip
summary: Tottenham target Everton winger Iliman Ndiaye, Chelsea set to rival Spurs for Juventus striker Jonathan David, and Liverpool linked with Â£88m move for Inter's Alessandro Bastoni.

title: 'Scotland looked immortality in the eye and said not today'
summary: Tom English reflects on Scotland's "exhilarating and infuriating" display in the 25-17 defeat by New Zealand at Murrayfield.

title: 'Scotland looked immortality in the eye and said not today'
summary: Tom English reflects on Scotland's "exhilarating and infuriating" display in the 25-17 defeat by New Zealand at Murrayfield.

title: Verstappen can 'forget about' winning world title
summary: Max Verstappen says he can "forget about" winning the world championship after a chastening Saturday at the Sao Paulo Grand Prix.

title: England beat physical Fiji for ninth consecutive win
summary: England score four second-half tries to see off Fiji in their second autumn international at Allianz Stadium.

title: Norwich sack Manning after seventh home loss
summary: Norwich City sack head coach Liam Manning after just 17 games in charge following a seventh successive home Championship defeat.

title: Djokovic out of ATP Finals after winning 101st title
summary: Novak Djokovic secures the 101st title of his career with victory at the Hellenic Championships - then has to withdraw from the ATP Finals because of injury.

title: Charles-Barclay wins Ironman after 'tough' period
summary: Britain's Lucy Charles-Barclay overcomes injury and family bereavement to win her second Ironman 70.3 world title.

title: Watched by 132,418 fans - but will Rugby League Ashes stay?
summary: England's Rugby League Ashes experience ended in a 3-0 series defeat - but is that proof they need more games against Australia? And will they get them?

summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has urged the club to "look forward" rather than "dwell on the past" after comments from Cristiano Ronaldo in which the former United player criticised the club, adding Amorin could not work "miracles".

title: 'I deeply hurt people by moving to Saudi Arabia'
summary: In an interview with BBC Sport, Ashleigh Plumptre says she regrets losing the trust of some LGBT fans in women's football by moving to Saudi Arabia.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.
